reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window.
He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors.
Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected.
"You were here in September," he said.
"Why are you back so soon?"
"I came in September to prepare to return this month," I replied with a trembling voice, considering if I missed any Italian regulations.
"For how long?" he asked.
"One month, this time," I answered truthfully.
I knew it was not against the rules to stay in Italy for three months.
"Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport.
Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air.
My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 목적으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: 불친절한 입국 심사관에 대해 불평하기 위해
입국 심사대에서의 긴장했던 경험을 묘사하기 위해
이탈리아 출입국 심사 절차를 안내하기 위해
이탈리아의 비자 규정에 대해 설명하기 위해

answer.explanation: 이 글은 필자가 입국 심사대에서 유독 한 심사관의 날카로운 질문에 긴장하고 불안해하다가, 무사히 통과한 후 안도감을 느꼈던 개인적인 경험을 생생하게 전달하고 있습니다. 따라서 글의 주된 목적은 긴장했던 경험을 묘사하는 것입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window.
He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors.
Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected.
"You were here in September," he said.

"I came in September to prepare to return this month," I replied with a trembling voice, considering if I missed any Italian regulations.
"For how long?" he asked.
"One month, this time," I answered truthfully.
I knew it was not against the rules to stay in Italy for three months.

Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air.
My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: How to Avoid Trouble at Borders

answer.explanation: 이 글의 핵심은 다른 심사관들과 달리 유독 심각한 표정으로 자신을 심문하는 권위적인 인물(심사관) 앞에서 필자가 느낀 심리적 압박감과 긴장입니다. 따라서 '권위의 심각한 얼굴'이라는 제목이 글의 중심 주제를 가장 잘 나타냅니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window.
He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors.
Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected.
"You were here in September," he said.
"Why are you back so soon?"
"I came in September to prepare to return this month," I replied with a trembling voice, considering if I missed any Italian regulations.
"For how long?" he asked.
"One month, this time," I answered truthfully.
I knew it was not against the rules to stay in Italy for three months.
"Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport.
Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air.
My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Passport control inspectors should maintain a friendly and relaxed attitude towards all travelers.
Traveling to the same country frequently can often lead to complicated legal issues.
Authority figures can create significant psychological pressure on individuals even when they are innocent.
It is essential to be fully aware of a country's regulations before traveling there.
A short and efficient immigration process greatly improves the overall travel experience for tourists.

answer.explanation: 글쓴이는 이탈리아 규정을 어기지 않았다는 사실을 알고 있었음에도 불구하고, 심사관의 진지한 태도와 날카로운 질문 앞에서 심리적 '부담(burden)'을 느꼈습니다. 이는 잘못이 없는 개인이라도 권위적인 인물 앞에서는 상당한 심리적 압박감을 느낄 수 있음을 보여줍니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window. He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors. Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected. "You were here in September," he said. "Why are you back so soon?" ( ① ) "I came in September to prepare to return this month," I replied with a trembling voice, considering if I missed any Italian regulations. ( ② ) "One month, this time," I answered truthfully. ( ③ ) I knew it was not against the rules to stay in Italy for three months. ( ④ ) "Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport. ( ⑤ ) Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air. My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**"For how long?" he asked.**

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 체류 기간을 묻는 질문입니다. 문맥상, 심사관이 '왜 이렇게 빨리 돌아왔는지' 묻고 글쓴이가 그 이유를 답한 직후, 추가적으로 '얼마나 오래 머물 것인지'를 묻는 것이 자연스러운 대화의 흐름입니다. 바로 뒤 문장에서 글쓴이가 '이번엔 한 달입니다'라고 답하는 것으로 보아, 주어진 질문은 ②의 위치에 들어가는 것이 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window. He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors.

question_blocks.A: I knew it was not against the rules to stay in Italy for three months. "Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport.
question_blocks.B: Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected. "You were here in September," he said. "Why are you back so soon?"
question_blocks.C: "I came in September to prepare to return this month," I replied with a trembling voice, considering if I missed any Italian regulations. "For how long?" he asked. "One month, this time," I answered truthfully.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 유독 한 심사관이 진지해 보였다는 내용입니다. (B)에서 그 때문에 불안감을 느꼈고, 심사관이 질문을 시작하는 내용으로 자연스럽게 이어집니다. (C)는 심사관의 질문에 대한 글쓴이의 답변과 이어지는 추가 질문-답변의 대화 내용입니다. 마지막으로 (A)에서 글쓴이의 내적 생각과 함께 심사관이 마침내 여권에 도장을 찍어주며 상황이 해결되는 내용으로 마무리됩니다. 따라서 (B)-(C)-(A)가 가장 적절한 순서입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
"Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport.
Whew! As I walked away, _________________________, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air.
My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: the happy memory of my last trip

answer.explanation: 빈칸 뒤에 '잘못한 것이 없음에도 불구하고'라는 내용이 이어지고, 그 다음 문장에서 '한때 짓눌렸던 내 어깨가 이제 편안하게 펴졌다'고 묘사합니다. 이는 심리적인 '부담감'이나 '짐'이 사라졌음을 의미합니다. 따라서 빈칸에는 '내가 짊어졌던 부담(the burden I had carried)'이 들어가는 것이 가장 적절합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The passport control line was ① `short` and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window. He seemed to want to model the ② `seriousness` of the task at hand for the other inspectors. Maybe that's why I felt ③ `uneasy` when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected. ... "Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport. Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, ④ `vanished` into the air. My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with ⑤ `pain`.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

answer.explanation: 글의 마지막 부분은 심사관의 허가를 받고 나서 느낀 안도감과 해방감을 묘사합니다. 'Whew!'라는 감탄사와 '부담감이 사라졌다'는 내용으로 보아, 짓눌렸던 어깨가 펴지면서 '편안함(comfort)'을 느껴야 자연스럽습니다. '고통(pain)'은 이러한 안도감의 맥락과 정반대되므로 적절하지 않습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked (A) `relaxed`... He seemed to want to (B) `model` the seriousness of the task... considering if I missed any Italian (C) `regulations`... "One month, this time," I answered (D) `truthfully`... As I walked away, the (E) `burden` I had carried... vanished into the air.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) relaxed: free from tension and anxiety; not worried
(B) model: to show other people how to do something so they can copy it
(C) regulations: official rules made by a government or other authority
(D) truthfully: in a way that is true and accurate
(E) burden: something that is pleasant and easy to do or deal with

answer.explanation: 본문에서 (E) burden은 '정신적 부담, 짐'이라는 의미로, 무겁고 힘든 것을 나타냅니다. 제시된 영영 풀이 '즐겁고 하기 쉬운 것'은 이와 정반대의 의미이므로 적절하지 않습니다. 'burden'의 올바른 영영 풀이는 'a load that is heavy to carry' 또는 'something that causes worry or difficulty' 입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The passport control line was (A) [short / long] and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window. He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors. Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more (B) [carefully / casually] than I expected. ... "Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport. Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, (C) [vanished / appeared] into the air.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: (A) 입국 심사 줄이 '짧았다(short)'는 것은 배경 설명으로, 곧이어 나오는 긴장된 상황과 대조를 이룹니다. (B) 심사관이 여권을 예상보다 더 '꼼꼼하게(carefully)' 살펴보았기 때문에 글쓴이가 불안함을 느꼈습니다. (C) 심사가 끝나자, 글쓴이가 느꼈던 부담감은 공기 중으로 '사라졌다(vanished)'고 표현하여 안도감을 나타냅니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked relaxed; except the inspector at my window.
He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors.
Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I expected.
"You were here in September," he said.
"Why are you back so soon?"
"I came in September to prepare to return this month," I replied with a trembling voice, considering if I missed any Italian regulations.
"For how long?" he asked.
"One month, this time," I answered truthfully.
I knew it was not against the rules to stay in Italy for three months.
"Enjoy your stay," he finally said, as he stamped my passport.
Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air.
My shoulders, once weighed down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 내용과 일치하는 것은?

options.text: 글쓴이가 갔을 때 입국 심사 줄이 매우 길었다.
글쓴이는 이번 방문에 석 달간 머물 예정이었다.
모든 입국 심사관들은 진지하고 엄격한 표정이었다.
심사관은 글쓴이가 이탈리아 규정을 어겼다고 생각했다.
글쓴이는 잘못한 것이 없었음에도 심리적 부담감을 느꼈다.

answer.explanation: 본문의 'the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air' 부분에서 글쓴이가 잘못한 것이 없음에도 불구하고 부담감을 느꼈음을 명확히 알 수 있습니다. ① 줄은 짧았고(short), ② 한 달(one month) 머물 예정이었고, ③ 글쓴이 창구의 심사관을 제외하고(except) 나머지는 편안해 보였고, ④ 심사관이 규정 위반을 생각했다는 내용은 없습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage:
① The passport control line was short and the inspectors looked [relaxed / relaxing]; except the inspector at my window.
He seemed to want to model the seriousness of the task at hand for the other inspectors.
Maybe that's why I felt uneasy when he studied my passport more carefully than I ② [expected / was expected].
... Whew! As I walked away, the burden I had carried, even though I did nothing wrong, vanished into the air.
③ My shoulders, once [weighed / weighing] down, now stretched out with comfort.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 동사 looked의 주격보어로, 주어인 'the inspectors'가 편안함을 '느끼는' 상태이므로 감정의 수동을 나타내는 과거분사 'relaxed'가 맞습니다. 'relaxing'은 '편안하게 해주는'이라는 능동의 의미입니다.
than 뒤의 절에서 주어인 'I'가 '예상했던' 것이므로 능동태 동사 'expected'가 와야 합니다. 'I expected (him to study it)'에서 목적어와 to 부정사가 생략된 형태입니다. 수동태 'was expected'는 문맥상 어색합니다.
주어 'My shoulders'를 수식하는 분사구문으로, 어깨가 (부담감에 의해) '짓눌리는' 수동의 관계이므로 과거분사 'weighed'가 맞습니다. 이는 'once they were weighed down'에서 접속사와 주어, be동사가 생략된 형태로 볼 수 있습니다.
